snippet: Granting 50,000 visas to people with advanced degrees won’t save the down-and-out city, but they could help.
abstract: Editorial cautiously supports plan by Michigan Gov Rick Snyder to reinvigorate Detroit by bringing in 50,000 immigrants over five years using visa program for people with advanced degrees or exceptional abilities; says proposal, while appealing in some ways, could be viewed as defeatist or exclusionary in others; urges both careful enactment and larger ambition.
lead_paragraph: Granting 50,000 visas to people with advanced degrees won’t save the down-and-out city, but they could help.
